body:
Honestly, this backtick-quote thing bothers me too, but it's consistent with the standard Ruby errors format:

```ruby
NameError: undefined local variable or method `foo' for main:Object
```

Looks like it's a legacy from the old days, that, unfortunately, was widely popularized by TeX. Maybe it's a good idea to eliminate it at least in Rails sources, but to be consistent you should also take care of [some](https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/master/actionpack/lib/abstract_controller/layouts.rb#L374) [other](https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/master/activerecord/lib/active_record/model.rb#L122) [places](https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/master/activerecord/lib/active_record/attribute_methods/write.rb#L40) where this thing occurs.
